body.name: Cooler Master MasterLiquid 360 Atmos ARGB Close-Loop AIO Liquid Cooler, Customize Pump, Sickleflow Edge PWM Fans, 360mm Radiator, CryoFuze, AMD Ryzen AM5/AM4, Intel LGA1700/1200 (MLX-D24M-A25PZ-R1)
body.stockDetail: Only 4 left in stock - order soon.
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 23 hrs 52 mins.
features: Next Gen Dual Chamber Pump: Patented Next Gen dual chamber design refined for enhanced cooling synergy. Increased water pressure and optimized flow targeted directly at CPU hot spots.
Customize Your Pump Design: Personalize the pump top cover with your own unique 3D design. Create a one-of-a-kind design along with full control of Addressable Gen 2 RGB lighting.
Sickleflow Edge: Latest Sickleflow Edge 120mm fans pre-installed for superior cooling and a simpler streamlined user installation.
Fine Tuned Performance Ration: Precision-engineered ultra-thin spade fins have been designed to maximize microchannels, ensuring precise targeting of heat spots.
Going Green: Pump cover crafted from recycled plastics and 35% of metal components recyclable as well. 30% smaller packaging constructed with sustainable materials sets the Atmos as an eco-pioneer.
body.description: Introducing the MasterLiquid 360 Atmos, the epitome of next-generation AIO liquid cooling innovation. Atmos redefines your AIO cooler expectations with its visionary design and unrivaled features. Experience whisper-quiet operation, courtesy of our SickleFlow Edge fans. Seamlessly transition from unboxing to mastering your system with our user-friendly MasterCTRL software. Customize the pump top cover with your unique 3D-printed designs, showcasing our commitment to sustainability. Our refined dual chamber pump design, coupled with eco-friendly construction, sets a new standard in AIO liquid cooling. The Atmos: where cutting-edge technology meets a full 360 degrees of cooling excellence.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us We're all about the things that make building a PC such a rewarding experience. The sense of achievement. The joy of making and creating something uniquely yours in form and function and, of course, the thrill of bringing your creation to life without melting your components. 360 Atmos A Cooler Future The next generation AIO liquid cooling is here with the MasterLiquid 360 Atmos. The Atmos is our forward-thinking, innovative take on what an AIO cooler can and should be. Exceptionally silent performance provided by our SickleFlow Edge fans. An optimized user experience from unboxing to the MasterCTRL software. A pump top cover fully customizable with your own 3D-printed creations. Going Green construction implemented throughout. Our signature dual chamber pump design, refined. Next Gen Dual Chamber Pump Customize Your Pump Design Sickleflow Edge 120mm Fans Pre-Installed Fine Tuned Performance Ratio Frosted Blade Design Going Green Included Tube Clips Slim & Sleek Radiator

Features Next Gen Dual Chamber Pump Patented Next Gen dual chamber design refined for enhanced cooling synergy. Increased water pressure and optimized flow targeted directly at CPU hot spots. Customize Your Pump Design Personalize the pump top cover with your own unique 3D design. Create a one-of-a-kind design along with full control of Addressable Gen 2 RGB lighting. Sickleflow Edge Latest Sickleflow Edge 120mm fans pre-installed for superior cooling and a simpler streamlined user installation. Fine Tuned Performance Ratio Precision-engineered ultra-thin spade fins have been designed to maximize microchannels, ensuring precise targeting of heat spots.

Frosted Blade Design We've revitalized our frosted blade design to improve the dispersion of ARGB lighting, creating a more vivid and customizable luminous effect. Going Green Pump cover crafted from recycled plastics and 35% of metal components recyclable as well. 30% smaller packaging constructed with sustainable materials sets the Atmos as an eco-pioneer. Included Tube Clips Clean up and organize your cooler and build with included tube clips. Slim & Sleek Radiator The low-profile radiator, boasting superior fin density, in conjunction with high-performance fans, efficiently and rapidly dissipates heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It's quite easy to install. fans are silent. RGB colors work great, temperatures are fine. Works with AURA sync without issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Silent Pump, Great Cooling
reviews.reviewText: This cooler works great. I'm coming from TWO EK CR240 coolers that developed grinding pumps within a month. Installing this, the pump is dead quiet, and using the same fans (Phanteks T30) and same thermal paste across all of them, this runs about 5c cooler than the EK coolers. It could be the large difference is due to the pumps, which seem to have been defective. Either way, this cooler is dead silent and cools well. You don't have to use all of the RGB nonsense it comes with and deal with a big nest of cables, either. If you just want to install the cooler without fan RGB it's just the PWM pump header and the fan header on the mobo. You can plug the pump head in to any 2nd gen RGB plug on the motherboard, too. It's a very clean install overall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does it’s job
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Cooler works great. Keeps my CPU around 30 C. RGB is good and syncs up with everything else. Easy to install. Isn’t too loud either.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Missing Parts, but they were replaced
reviews.reviewText: EDIT: Missing parts are no longer missing and this thing is quiet and doing great. I love this thing... after fixing the issue Cooler Master went from 1 star to 4.I purchased this months ago for a future build, but when I went to install this I found that there were 2 missing parts and that without them, I won't be able to complete the build. I see a few other reviews have cited missing parts as well. The parts missing are the wiring harnesses. I've tried to use their customer support site but it has not been helpful (very glitzy, but forms don't work). If you look at my purchase history, I have a long history of buying Cooler Master products, but this experience will turn me off from future purchases.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Replaced the preinstalled AIO in my flight simulator i9-13900k unit that failed after six months. Getting a real nice chill at rest and very good cooling under stress whilst flying in VR with an RTX-4090 gpu. My only wish is for the cooling tubes to be on the other end of the radiator. Install was flawless with all parts provided. I didn't use the included box, wiring it straight up. CoolerMaster does such an excellent job with after market AIOs there's really no need to look elsewhere.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent 240L water cooler
reviews.reviewText: This 240L water cooler from Cooler Master is replacing and Enermax made 120L RGB water cooler than served me well for approx. 2 years, but the pump developed a rattling noise that was very disturbing, and CPU temps were reaching 100C. I realized that the water pump was going to leave me.This was for an Intel 8 core I7 9700 CPU. I removed the Enermax and replaced with the Intel air cooler that came with the CPU. The system became quiet and temps stabilized around 50C which are normal.I ordered ths Cooler master that had excellent reviews. Very nice and quality built. Instl instructions were very easy to follow. CAme with the Creo fuse thermal paste that was fairly easy to apply, without any applicator. Straight from the tube. Installed everything and presto. System works very quietly and the temp stabilized around 32 C. the 2 fans are actually very quiet. Very happy with this new water cooler.The only con is the RGB. It's suited for 3 pin RGB headers while my motherboard, an Asus Z390-P model, comes with a 4 pin RGB header that is unusable. But this is a minor con. I will look for a 4 pin to 3 pin adapter cable, then this will work with RGB lights. Not an issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Huge difference from previous cooler, but packaging leaves a lot to be desired
reviews.reviewText: I was torn on buying either this model or the arctic liquid freezer ii. In all honesty, I chose this model because it would arrive much quicker, and I regret my decision. I don't really care for RGB in my pc so I would have been much happier paying a little less to lose the flashy display. This was my first AIO and to be honest, the packaging and instructions are just flat out, lacking. The instructions are crudely printed with white images on the back of the black boxes for each compartment with little to no text directing you. The images are small and not very detailed with no clear guidance and their website is even less helpful. It took me a few youtube searches to finally get the process down enough to start the install.One thing that is beyond annoying is the amount of wires. The fact that the three fans aren't daisy chained together makes no sense in this day and age. The 3 to 1 wire they include is stiff and difficult to work with. The CPU plug on my motherboard is at the very top so trying to get it connected but also angled so it went behind the radiator left plenty of scratches on my fingers. For the pictures on the box for the RGB connections, you are to assume you have to either connect all of them using the 5 to 1 cable they include or the control box. If you work with RGB on a regular basis then you would know you could just connect each of the plugs together using the male and female plugs, but since this is my first time working with RGB I had no idea. After plugging everything in and connecting the pump to my cpu I turned on my PC to test everything out and at first it looked like everything was running perfectly. My temp was down, the lights were on and the fans were spinning, at 100%. I knew these were PWM fans so I tried to adjust the speed with the bios, but nothing would change the speed. Finally I decided to remove the included 3 to 1 plug and use one of my own and that, for some reason, solved the fan spinning problem.Next problem, my temps started spiking. I am running an AM5 7800X3D and my cpu usage was at 0-1% so there shouldn't have been any of the spikes I was seeing. I assumed it was the paste application since that's usually the easiest fix so I took off the pump and cleaned the paste only to notice an imperfection on the copper. There was a small black spot that wasn't a scratch and didn't feel like a groove. I tried cleaning it with isopropyl alcohol but it was not coming off so it was either from the factory or something happened during shipping. There was no protective film over the copper, just the paste applicator pattern, so I don't know for sure what it was, the only thing I knew was I didn't drop, slam or scratch it. I requested a replacement and after inspecting it for any imperfections, reinstalled it and so far it's running like a champ. Temps are steady and much better compared to my previous air cooler.I'm sorry for the long winded review but I wanted to share from the perspective of a new AIO owner and how painful the whole process was. If I had to do it all again, I would have just purchased the Arctic, but since I've already done an exchange and installed another model, I'll just keep it so I don't cost Amazon any more money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If you are doing this with AMD, there will be an open gap on the backplate until you tighten the screws. You are doing it right. You aren't missing an spacers. Just put it together as shown and everything will work out.As for the AIO, it's good. The lights work well with my MSI motherboard. It keeps my CPU cool. When not under load, my 5950X stays in the low 30s C and under max load it tops out between 60 and 65 C.
Works good. Doesn’t leave for a lot of space in smaller cases.

reviews.reviewTitle: Llego antes, muy bien empaquetado y en excelentes condiciones. Hasta el momento todo excelente.
reviews.reviewText: Llego un día antes, venía muy bien empaquetado. Todo bien hasta el momento. En cuanto termine de instalarlo en la computadora comento que tal va.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente componente y calidad de vendedor.
reviews.reviewText: Es totalmente nuevo, viene con todo lo que necesitas para instalarlo y vale la pena.

Una decepción, inicié el proceso de reembolso porque mi procesador está todo el tiempo por arriba de 90 grados centígrados sin carga de trabajo, no lo recomiendoEs como si el radiador no permitiera el flujo del liquido y no se siente el calor de disipación saliendo del radiador.
did not come with proprietary and necessary part for installation. it needed a clipaable heat sync, this was another 10 dollars to buy.
